Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Chad Blair "Chad"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap (very cheap) camera to use while rock climbing.  If I had beat the crap out of the camera before the day was done then I would have nobody to blame but myself.  If the camera had simply not functioned due to a day of punishment on the rocks then I would have nobody to blame but myself.However, after taking nearly 30+ pictures throughout the course of the day documenting the ascent I came home to find that only one (1!) was still extant.  The last picture.  The LAST picture!  Argh.  It *appears* the camera reset itself back to its factory defaults just before the last picture of the day, formatting the hard drive in the process.  Dunno.I wasn't expecting brilliance.  I wasn't expecting a lot of features.  I wasn't expecting amazing pictures.  I just expected the camera to retain the pictures it took.Too much to ask, I guess.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, lightweight-- think of it as a disposable digital camera
Reviews.Author: Lori Culwell "Author"
Reviews.Content: I gave these away as part of a wedding party, and they were great.  Actually, they were exactly like the old film-based disposable cameras you used to be able to get a few years ago, only digital.  Do you have huge expectations of the quality and long-term nature of the camera?  No, but at this price, it's a great camera for kids, for special occasion purposes like weddings, or for a vacation where you don't want to overload your phone with photos, but you don't necessarily want to lug your super-fancy camera to risk losing it or having it stolen, plus it's light-weight, so it doesn't hog up your suitcase space.  I also found the photos on this little camera to be extremely easy to download.  All in all, I felt like this camera over-delivered for the price.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for (in this case)
Reviews.Author: BronzeWarrior
Reviews.Content: I did not expect to get a grade A camera (for which I paid less than $15). But the photo quality is absolutely TERRIBLE, and many pictures ended up completely sabotaged. I would recommend this to no one.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother.
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Setzler
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was the software, maybe it was the camera, maybe his shoes were too tight, but this didn't connect to the computer and display pictures. I'm not even sure it took pictures. It's cheap, basically a pinhole camera with a button. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: Did not work
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: When my granddaughter open the camera on Christmas morning the camera would not work!She and I both were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Regret purchasing
Reviews.Author: ShammyD
Reviews.Content: I figured the deal was too good to be true being it only cost $16.There is no back screen for you to see the pictures you've taken. You'll have to upload the images to your computer in order to view them. That can prove problematic if you don't have a CD compartment on your comp. You'll have to download the imaging software in order for your computer to recognize the camera. Also, there really isn't much of a splash to show you that you've snapped a photo. You'll truly only know when you see the number go down.

Reviews.Title: worst 10 bucks ever spent
Reviews.Author: C. borda
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap digital camera for my kid. Easy to use, etc.  Although easy to use, and cheap at 10 bucks, it is the WORST pictures I have ever seen on any camera - even in sol call HD mode. Tried all modes and settings. All pics look blurry,fuzzy,out of focus, lousy. Very disappointed. For ten bucks, you should at least get something that takes a decent picture. The software disc you install is the only cool thing in the package. Makes you wish you had a decent camera to play around with the vivatar experience disc.  Vivatar should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: terrible pictures
Reviews.Author: Karin Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter so she can take pictures of her cat and she did not like it at all. The pictures came out very blurry. In the description it says you can take up to 200 pictures but how? She wasn't even able to get 100. We since bought another Vivitar at Walmart for $30 and it works great. I am sending this one back.

Reviews.Title: lousy picture quality
Reviews.Author: archie curran
Reviews.Content: this is truely a piece of junk. built terrible, turns off on you in about 15 seconds. produces poor images. throwing mine out.

Reviews.Title: Uuuummm yea...
Reviews.Author: LittleBluRidinHood
Reviews.Content: I won this on a stacker machine so I'm not quite complaining but it's not a very good camera. It feels cheap and it doesn't even have a screen. I have a Vivitar video cam that works great and I love it- despite its lack of a tripod screw in area thing- but I paid 50 cents for this one so I don't much care. It's kinda like a digital disposable camera.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: kkrystle
Reviews.Content: The item was a dollar store camera. I paid 26 and saw it in dollar general for 10. Total rip off i was not satisfied . I gave it to my 3 year old daughter

Reviews.Title: Worse than my low expectations
Reviews.Author: SaraC
Reviews.Content: When I bought the cheapest camera I could find, I knew I was sacrificing quality for price, but I didn't know that cameras got this bad!  The manual is available online from Vivitar's website, and I wish I had read it before buying.  Removing the batteries or allowing them to run low will result in all photos being deleted.  The highest quality photo is 640x480, which is not quite good enough to get prints made, and the photos look awful even for that resolution.  And it only stores 26 photos at that size.The camera was unusably bad.  I would only recommend it if you have to have a digital camera, can download the photos off of it daily, only need to take tiny photos, don't mind the low quality, don't have a cell phone with a camera, and you have only $15 to spend.

Reviews.Title: no flash
Reviews.Author: RAFAEL
Reviews.Content: i wish i would of known before buying this camera that it didn't come with a flash and it looks like a "kiddy camera"

Reviews.Title: camera sucks
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: it says on the package from dollar general and takes terrible pictures once u figure out how to even take one picture!!! Worst thing i have bought ever! IT's plastic and needs batteries and u dont need a memory card like the description said.

Reviews.Title: cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: This camera is very cheaply mad. it is a very light weight plastic and it is not compatible with windows

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera. Sorry I spent this much money on it!
Reviews.Author: Rachel Leyva
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a good buy.  Difficult to take pictures.  And why in the world do you suggest one should buy the SD card.  It doesn't even take one.  FALSE ADVERTISING!

Reviews.Title: not working
Reviews.Author: jared canku
Reviews.Content: the camera is not working, and i have thrown away the box and the receipt that came with it, so i can not use it, when you turn it on the red light just blinks and will not do anything at all, i have tried new batteries about 10 times and it still won't work

Reviews.Title: Beginner's Camera
Reviews.Author: Henry G. Weimar "wee man"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use.  I decided to give mine to my eight-year-old great-granddaughter.  It was a good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: No Flash
Reviews.Author: Tom J.
Reviews.Content: This camera does not have a flash capability which greatly limits its usage. However, it's not a bad camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Marshall H Schubert "Marshall"
Reviews.Content: My order was processed just fine.However upon arriving, I placed the requisite 2 X AAA batteries in the camera, and hit the  on- ("mode") button.  The camera simply failed to turn on.I opened a 2nd, separate package of AAA's and tried it again.  No good.The camera simply was non-functional.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Evans
Reviews.Content: It us a good deal for the meager price you pay.  Its best feature is that it hold up to 200 pictures.

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: C. Vitale
Reviews.Content: Christmas present for my daughter who is a big picture fan. SHe asked for this all season and was pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: great for kids
Reviews.Author: tinyt
Reviews.Content: great for my daughter's first camera.take pics and download on computer, the camera only takes 25 pictures but is great for kids.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment no SDHC card slot
Reviews.Author: granny
Reviews.Content: The description said it could take a SDHC card and it does not.  Will return.  It was to be 1st camera for 2 grandkids

Reviews.Title: Resolution way too low
Reviews.Author: Thomas Boese
Reviews.Content: I knew we were buying cheap but the camera is totally useless.  Does not even make  good disposable camera.  Do not purchase

Reviews.Title: Hate it
Reviews.Author: Natalie Meadows
Reviews.Content: Very poor quality and was just a cheap plastic camera.  I guess you get what you pay for.  Returned it as soon as I opened the package and looked at it.

Reviews.Title: Not at all what we expected
Reviews.Author: Kendra Holloway
Reviews.Content: Not user friendly. Too many cryptic codes and buttons. Took 80 photos and never were able to retrieve them. Threw the camera away.

Reviews.Title: vivitar digital camera
Reviews.Author: Betty J Willoughby
Reviews.Content: very hard to focus. When you think you have full item in view finder and then download it, you discover you only have half of the item. Same item is available in the family dollar store for $10.00 and it is not worth any more than that, certainly not 29.95 plus S&H.;

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Pementell
Reviews.Content: Cheap price... cheap camera;  Very difficult to center shot through view finder / meaning point & shoot many times!Eventually one of about 50 attempts may be centered correctly.

Reviews.Title: Perfect to give as a gag gift or to an enemy
Reviews.Author: Sunnydale
Reviews.Content: Discover a few of this camera's most prominent qualities:1-Very lightweight, since it has none of those pesky, useless features (any zoom at all, a flash, and the like) that clutter up the typical camera.2-It looks exactly like a cheap toy, so it's great for giving to one of your kids if it costs no more than a dollar and the child has no expectation at all of getting usable pictures out of it.3-No way to view your photos until you upload them to your computer, at which point you'll probably find that each pic either chops off the top of Grandma's head, is so blurry it makes your orange cat look like a fuzzy pumpkin, or closely resembles the inside of a sealed mausoleum.4-Does not include a slot for an SD card. The internal memory, when the camera was placed on the poorest possible settings, allowed a maximum of about 105 photos that each looked like the underside of a muddy rock. In fact, they were taken at a beach on a reasonably sunny day. When the camera was placed on the highest quality settings, it allowed a maximum of about 26 photos. Stop for a moment and imagine the least attractive shade of dull gray you can. Ready? Okay, now you know what those photos looked like.5-Takes only very brief (less than one minute total) video clips of astonishingly poor quality even when used in excellent lighting.6-All photos/videos are erased if you completely run down or simply remove the batteries.7-All photos/videos sometimes magically disappear even if you don't run down or remove the batteries.8-The viewing window you look through when framing your photos is microscopic and as blurry as one's vision after a three-day bender.My $10 cell phone takes better photos than this thing. Please don't claim that the low price of this camera is an excuse for its abysmal quality. I mean, when a cheapo cell photo outperforms a camera, that's just plain pathetic.

Reviews.Title: Don't like
Reviews.Author: Donnetta Gillespie
Reviews.Content: When I opened the package, I was very disappointed. It wasn't what I wanted. I don't know what to do with it. Maybe I'll give it to someone. Oh well that's life.

Reviews.Title: A good beginner digital cam
Reviews.Author: Chris Keach
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures at the high resolution setting. Very limited video capability. Great for a kids first camera or an inexpensive stand-in when you don't want to damage a more expensive cam.

Reviews.Title: vivitar camera
Reviews.Author: tesasmommy
Reviews.Content: good camera for someone if you want to start with digital.  It is a good size. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: LD
Reviews.Content: Camera is just as shown.  Great for a Christmas or birthday gift.  Purchased for mygranddaughter.  She will like taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Meredith D. Gibbons
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little camera for the younger children or the beginner.  It's size is fine, but not as convenient as the phone/camera options today.

Reviews.Title: first camera for young photographers
Reviews.Author: T. Hill
Reviews.Content: I bought these items to give to my grand daughters who are 10 and 8. They are fine for this age group. I would recommend for the first camera to learn to take photos.

Reviews.Title: I Got What I Paid For
Reviews.Author: Ms. "J"
Reviews.Content: It fit the need I had, which was taking photos and uploading them. The quality of the pictures was a little dark, but I could still make out my subject. Plus, the images came out sharp. And, not difficult to use. My disc drive, on my computer, is damaged and I had to find a different way to install software. I contacted the company and they emailed me a link where I could go instead. After clicking on the link, I was able to install software. Would recommend if you don't want to spend a large amount of money. Or, you don't do a lot of photographing.

Reviews.Title: camera.
Reviews.Author: Donna Killmade
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent starter camera for kids to learn on and it would be perfect for my kids. thanks

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: bmc870
Reviews.Content: sorry - I sent this off for a birthday present and the little guy loves it. sorry for the late feedback.

Reviews.Title: A great gift!
Reviews.Author: D. J. O'brien
Reviews.Content: Who doesn't like having their own camera!  And it will also go along with the Picture Keepers I also purchased.  Even just alone always makes for a great gift!

Reviews.Title: perfect snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: Bill Raley "Vista Bill"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a (digital) snapshot camera like the old 'film cameras'. With an old fashioned view finder and if I lost or damaged it, I would not get upset. This Vivitar camera appeared to be what I wanted. Received it today and wasn't disappointed with the appearance and quality of this inexpensive camera. I took a single photo indoors. It has no flash. Installed the 'Vivitar Experience Image Manager' software and downloaded my picture. I wasn't disappointed. Remember, I wanted a simple snapshot camera and that's what I got! The picture was a bit 'out of focus' and since the photo I took was in a dark part of the room, the resulting photo was not bright but it was 'viewable'. The camera's shutter is very positive and I felt confident that it had snapped the picture. You cannot see the picture until it has been downloaded using the included software. This is nice, simple photo editing software but it is a bit slow responding. Once one gets used to it, it is ideal for downloading the Vivitar pictures. I'm pleased with my $12 camera. It is exactly what I wanted. By the way, you can do a short video with it also.

Reviews.Title: realy
Reviews.Author: buddybean
Reviews.Content: realyI don't think I have that much to sayI don't think I have that much to say  buy

Reviews.Title: i was very disapointed in this camera
Reviews.Author: tammy adams
Reviews.Content: i was looking for a camera for my 12yr old nephew i was very disappointed in this camera. i wouldnt buy it to even give it to a younger child

ProductInfo.Features:
Takes videos
Takes photos
Can act like a webcam
Great for a starter camera
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar V69379-SIL 3-IN-1 2 MP Digital Camera - Body Only (Silver)
